metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10784 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Basic authentication code in WEBrick library in Ruby before 2.2.8, 2.3.x before 2.3.5, and 2.4.x through 2.4.1 allows remote attackers to inject terminal emulator escape sequences into its log and possibly execute arbitrary commands via a crafted user name.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10784` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
libtcltk-ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ri1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.1-examples - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.1-full - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.3 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

libruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10
ruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10
ruby2.0-tcltk - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby1.9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5').
ruby2.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10').
